title: R-45521 Site Lead - Mariannelund Hub
description:
**Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy:** we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.
  
We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
  
In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.
  
We are hiring a new Services Site Lead based for our Service center in Mariannelund.
  
How to contribute to our vision
  
As our new Site Lead you are responsible of the daily management & supervision of the Service technicians to ensure effective planning and execution of service, operation and warranty for approximately 50 turbines in your service hub area. Build a long-term perspective with the team to ensure that Siemens Gamesa delivers high performance and value to the customer.
  
  

**Some of your responsibilities will be:**  

Perform assignments by the responsible Operations Manager.
  
Coordination, planning and execution of service, operation and support for assigned site or travelling technician team. Including resource planning, vacancy & work schedule in co-operation with central planning.
  
Ensure safety is #1, all technicians have the adequate training, safety equipment, work instructions and risk assessments before starting any work. Continuous follow up and improvement of incidents to implement improvements. Ensure site staff and subcontractors are informed and is following the agreed overall EHS procedures and site specific EHS plan in the organization.
  
Utilize local and regional technical support to solve issues at site.
  
Take corrective actions, address shortfalls and make improvements to drive the service teams.
  
Responsible for continuous development and improvement of productivity and KPI’s as well as other site / contractual goals supported by Ops Manager.
  
Provide Monthly reporting to Customers and manage site monthly meetings towards the customer with the support of the Ops Mgr.
  
Build the long-term perspective with the Customer as site contact and toward Suppliers to build lasting relationships.
  
Managing work in varying conditions to adopt planning of works and resources to fulfil contractual obligations, optimize WF production and team productivity.
  
Manage team to complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.
  
Site administration including reporting, handling orders, keep records etc.
  
  

What you need to make a difference
  
Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.
  
The ideal candidate has a technical/vocational diploma just as it is preferred that you have an electrical and/or mechanical background and experience. You have some years of experience in a leadership role
  
  

**In this role you also:**  

Demonstrate highly effective Planning and organizational skills
  
Have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and preferable wind turbine experience is demonstrated
  
Are able to work independently or in a team environment
  
Have excellent Swedish and English skills - verbal and written
  
You possess a driver’s license (B)
  
You must be physically in good shape and not afraid of heights – medical examination required including Swedish “mast och stolpintyg”.
  
  

In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.
  
In return of your commitment we offer you…
  
**Become a part of our mission for sustainability:** Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as employee discounts and much more
  
Empowering our people
  
https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees
  
How do you imagine the future?
  
https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY
  
Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.
  
Other information
  
If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Operations Manager Cecilia Sjöberg +46 702 01 59 68
  
For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send an email to the recruiter Andreas Lindin via andreas.lindin.ext@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.
  
Please apply in English via the apply button.
company_description: Siemens Gamesa brings together a team of over 25,000 employees of close to 100 nationalities working in over 90 countries around the world.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description
  
We can affect people’s everyday lives with our work together here at Trekki.
  
In addition to interesting projects, we want to ensure that you have a work-life balance. Want to join our diverse community?
  
We are looking for experienced software developers to work in our beautiful capital Stockholm. What is it that we’re looking for now? Passionate people who want to work on meaningful projects and help others around them shine!
  
We are an IT consulting company that provides consultants for customers. The diversity of our customers also gives opportunities for continuous learning. Our aim is to always find the right project for the best person, and make sure it’s a two-way match.
  
Job Description
  
Basic qualifications
  
Bachelor or MS in Computer Science or a relevant technical discipline
  
5+ years of software development experience
  
Experience with one or more common web-backend languages such as (but not limited to) Java, Go, .Net, C/ C++/C#, Python, Node.js, and/or one or more common frontend languages such as JavaScript, React, Angular or similar.
  
SQL Server and/or NoSQL databases
  
Unit testing frameworks (for backend developers)
  
Best development practices like Agile
  
Strong written and verbal English communication skills.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Preferred Qualifications
  
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
  
Proven experience building server software on a cloud platform
  
Hands-on experience in one or more of the following technologies: Kubernetes, Docker, Postman, Git, Maven, Gradle
  
Working experience with REST APIs and designing
  
Messaging within a microservice architecture using Kafka or similar
  
Spring, Spring Boot, JMS (for Java Developers)
  
Knowledge of relevant standards in the area of your expertise
  
Creative debugging skills
  
  

Soft skills we’re looking for
  
Open-minded, cooperative, and interested in new technologies
  
Ability to energize yourself and the people around you
  
A team player
  
Passion for people and making the world a better place
  
  

Additional Information
  
What we offer
  
A diverse international work environment
  
Opportunities to develop cutting-edge technology for well-known companies
  
Opportunities to work on a variety of projects, also promoting individual development
  
The Trekki company culture.
  
Being part of a wonderful and highly engaged team where you'll never feel alone!
  
Sponsorship of your work permit application (for those in Sweden)
  
Health/ Life/ Occupational injury/ Occupational pension insurance.
  
Health activities annual budget
  
30 days paid leave (Vacation)
  
and many more!
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Hi! We’re excited you’re here :** )
  
This opening is for our partner, Planboo.
  
We help organizations around the world build teams for a sustainable future. Together we are on a mission to leverage technology to regenerate our planet and advance human potential.
  
Planboo is committed to revolutionizing carbon removal through innovative biochar solutions. Working with climate-conscious businesses, farmers, land stewards, and biochar producers, Planboo provides the tools, technology, and training needed to transform sustainably sourced biomass into biochar, generating carbon removal credits and enhancing soil health. Their mission is to permanently remove CO₂ from the atmosphere, supporting people and food systems to prosper.
  
The Challenge
  
Are you an experienced Backend Engineer looking to take on a leadership role in a mission-driven organization? As the Tech Lead Software Engineer at Planboo, you will architect and build scalable backend systems that power our innovative biochar solutions. You will spearhead the brainstorming and development of creative solutions to complex technical challenges, working closely with your team and cross-functional teams to drive our mission forward.
  
**Your challenge:** Lead the development of robust systems that scale our carbon removal technology globally.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
**Technical Leadership:** Set the technical direction and establish best practices that enable the team to succeed in building reliable and scalable software.
  
**Product Development:** Collaborate with the product team to continuously improve existing products and develop new features that align with our roadmap.
  
**Team Mentorship:** Guide and support team members as the team grows, providing technical mentorship and fostering a collaborative work environment.
  
**Integration:** Collaborate with hardware teams for software-hardware integration.
  
**Backend Development:** Architect and develop scalable backend services.
  
**DevOps & CI/CD:** Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines, and manage containerization using Docker.
  
**Cloud Infrastructure:** Manage and optimize cloud resources on AWS, leveraging services like ECS, S3, RDS and Lambda.
  
**Microservices & Scalability:** Design and implement robust, scalable, and fault-tolerant systems.
  
**Data Management:** Work with relational databases(PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  
**Security & Performance:** Ensure system security, scalability, and performance optimization.
  
  

Requirements
  
What We’re Looking For
  
4+ years of experience in Software Engineering.
  
Experience with software development, system design, and architecture.
  
Experience with developing RESTful APIs and integrating third-party API’s.
  
Strong expertise in AWS and cloud-native tools.
  
Strong understanding of CI/CD tools and modern software design patterns for scalable and maintainable systems
  
Experience in managing containerization using Docker.
  
Knowledge of security frameworks for user and service authentication and authorization.
  
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for mission-driven work.
  
Having taken on a leadership role in a project or team setting.
  
  

Nice-to-Haves
  
Experience with TypeScript/JavaScript.
  
Experience with headless CMS platforms.
  
Familiarity with BI integration tools (such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
  
Knowledge in serverless architecture.
  
Experience with hardware or IoT-integrated solutions.
  
Experience with carbon removal projects, embedded systems, or working in international, mission-driven teams.
  
  

Benefits
  
What We Offer You
  
An opportunity to make a measurable, positive impact on global carbon removal efforts.
  
The chance to work directly with Planboo’s leadership team and contribute to high-level strategic decision-making.
  
A flexible, mission-driven work environment with room for personal and professional growth.
  
Travel opportunities to project locations, including spending time in Sri Lanka for several weeks.
  
  

Who We Are
  
Join a diverse team of engineers, farmers, scientists, and visionaries tackling global challenges. We believe in Win-Win collaboration, Relentlessness, and Authenticity. Planboo is committed to advancing CO2 removal, addressing global inequality, and fostering a workplace where diversity of thought is celebrated.
  
Planboo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, and we encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.

title: IT Technician
description:
Visual Art is part of the Vertiseit Group, listed on Nasdaq First North Growth Market in Sweden. We are 280+ employees around the world - with on a mission connecting a world of retail.
  
Job Description and Key Responsibilities We are looking for an IT Technician to join our Global Internal IT team, a group function supporting all employees and companies within the Vertiseit group. As an IT Technician at Vertiseit, you will play a vital role in ensuring smooth IT operations across the organisation.
  
As an IT Technician, you will be responsible for tasks such as:
  
Provide hands-on IT support to employees across the group, with a primary focus on supporting our Stockholm office, resolving technical issues efficiently and with high service quality.
  
Work within the Microsoft 365 environment and Azure AD.
  
Manage devices in Microsoft Intune to ensure compatibility and security.
  
Handle basic networking tasks to maintain connectivity and reliability.
  
Support and contribute to ongoing IT initiatives and improvements.
  
  

Your Profile We believe the person we are looking for is curious, service-minded, eager to take on new challenges and willing to learn.
  
At Vertiseit, we work together as a team with a flexible and solution-oriented mindset. No task is too small or too big—we all pitch in where needed to ensure smooth IT operations. Whether it’s helping a colleague set up a new device, troubleshooting a complex issue, or contributing to long-term IT improvements, you are willing to take on a variety of tasks and enjoy working in a dynamic environment.
  
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and qualifications:
  
Proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
  
Experience working in a Microsoft 365 and Azure AD environment.
  
Basic understanding of networking concepts like DHCP, DNS, Firewalls, VLAN's, etc
  
Familiarity with both Windows and Mac devices and OS.
  
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  
Any experience with Microsoft Intune is an advantage
  
  

What we offer
  
A dynamic and inclusive workplace with fair and competitive employment conditions.
  
A strong focus on employee well-being, including health initiatives and a wellness allowance.
  
A collaborative and engaging work environment where we enjoy social activities together.
  
Opportunities for professional growth and internal career development.
  
Skilled and supportive colleagues who contribute to an inspiring and innovative atmosphere.
  
  

This is a full-time position based at our Stockholm office, the headquarters of Visual Art. In this role, you will work closely with a colleague based in Stockholm while reporting to Emil Brandt, Vertiseit's Global Head of Internal IT, who is based in Varberg.
  
We recruit on an ongoing basis, with the last day of application being 2025-03-15
  
If you have any questions, feel free to contact Emil Brandt, Global Head of IT, at emil.brandt@vertiseit.com.
  
You can send your application in Swedish or in English.

title: Configuration Manager
description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning
  
Vår kunds IT-plattformar behöver genomgå omfattande tekniska, strukturella och processorienterade förändringar för att möta dagens krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och kapacitet gällande vårt el-kraftnät.
  
En del av detta är införandet av nytt balanseringssystem.
  
  

För stabiliteten av detta system som krävs för detta införande söker vi för uppdrag hos vår kund nu en senior Configuration Manager som ska säkerställa konfigureringen för balanseringstjänsten. Som Configuration Manager för detta system kommer konsulten att tillhöra avdelningen Kraftsystem och elmarknad.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Som Configuration Manager (CM) på enheten Balanseringsapplikationer kommer arbetsuppgifter bland annat att innefatta: Versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
  
Hantera och underhålla versionshanteringssystem.
  
Säkerställer rätt version i rätt testmiljö.
  
Skapa och underhålla dokumentation för konfiguration, förändringar och releaser. Detta innefattar att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration. CM säkerställer identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
  
Ansvarar för att upprätta och implementera konfigurations-hanteringsprocess- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering både mot projekt och förvaltning.
  
Analysera omvärlden när olika produkter går end-of-life och samarbetar med plattformsteamen för att planera in behov av byten av infrakomponenter.
  
CM samarbetar med utvecklare och andra team för att säkerställa rätt konfiguration av mjukvara och deltar i utveckling- och deployprocessen för att säkerställa kvalité.
  
Identifiera och lösa problem relaterade till konfiguration och releaser.
  
  

**Skallkrav:**  

Högskole-/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom IT, data eller systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kunskaper genom erfarenhet.
  
**Kompetens och erfarenhet:** Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat som configuration manager inom IT.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från verksamhet med hög skyddsklass involverande samhällskritiska IT-system med hög tillgänglighet och säkerhetskrav under de senaste 10 åren.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att säkerställa identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att upprätta process- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering.
  
  

Mervärdeskrav
  
Certifiering inom exempelvis Configuration Management II (CMII), Certified Manager Certification (CM) eller liknande.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Azure DevOps och GIT.
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ITIL och agila utvecklingsmodeller.
  
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av förändringsledning i projekt/program och/eller linjeverksamhet inom IT.
  
  

Omfattning och villkor
  
Detta är en visstidsanställning på heltid under perioden 03-maj-2025 - 04-maj-2026, hos NXT Interim Stockholm AB, med uppdrag hos vår kund.
  
40 h per vecka och med option på förlängning. Vi tillämpar kollektivavtal.
  
Placering på vår kunds kontor i Sundbyberg.
  
Konsulten kan erbjudas att i viss mån arbeta från eget kontor. Distansarbete kan som maximalt uppgå till 50% av arbetstiden, vilket innebär att konsulten ska vara på plats i Sundbyberg minst 2-3 dagar/vecka. Detta beslutas i samråd med beställaren.
  
Låter detta som en intressant roll?
  
Sök redan i dag så berättar vi mer. Vi behöver en ansökan, inkluderat CV, på svenska, som matchar vår kunds önskemål. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan då vi behöver komplettera med mer information och anbudstiden är kort.
  
  

NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag som är verksamma inom konsult och rekryterings branschen. Vi är verksamma inom HR, IT, Ekonomi, Sälj och Marknad och har 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter bl a sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller deras vardag. Vid projektanställning tillämpar vi kollektivavtal.

title: IT-tekniker till TeamNorr i Härnösand
description:
Välkommen till en rejäl och smidig IT-avdelning
  
Drömmer du om en arbetsplats där teamkänsla, utveckling och engagemang är i fokus? Vi söker nu en serviceinriktad och trygg IT-tekniker till vårt kontor i Härnösand!
  
  

Lite om oss
  
TeamNorr är en rejäl och smidig IT-avdelning som arbetar nära och regelbundet för våra kunder runt om i Norrland. Vi tar ett helhetsgrepp om IT-miljön, från långsiktiga förbättringar till snabb IT-support. Vi finns lokalt med team på plats i Sundsvall, Härnösand, Sollefteå, Örnsköldsvik, Umeå, Lycksele, Skellefteå, Piteå, Luleå och Boden.
  
Vi är ett växande företag med korta beslutsvägar och en stark kultur av sammanhållning och gemensamma mål. Vi stöttar varandra i det dagliga arbetet, har roligt ihop och lär av varandra oavsett vilket kontor vi arbetar på.
  
Vi arbetar strukturerat och proaktivt utifrån vårt årshjul, där vi följer upp vårt arbete kvartalsvis genom IT-möten med våra kunder. På så sätt ser vi till att deras IT-miljö fungerar problemfritt idag och stöttar verksamhetens framtidsplaner.
  
  

**Vi hjälper våra kunder med:**  

✔ IT-säkerhet
  
✔ IT-support på plats & servicedesk
  
✔ Microsoft 365
  
✔ Nätverk
  
✔ Server & hosting
  
✔ Skrivare & dokumenthantering
  
✔ Telefoni & växel
  
✔ Utbildning
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som IT-tekniker hos oss blir du en viktig del av vårt lag av IT-tekniker, IT-konsulter, servicetekniker och kundansvariga. Vi ansvarar för allt från projektering, installationer, servicedesk och IT-support på plats till serverdrift, backup, molntjänster, telefoni och dokumenthantering.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bl.a. att inkludera:**  

Analysera kundens behov och utveckla lämpliga IT-lösningar
  
Planera och genomföra implementering av IT-lösningar
  
Konfigurera, underhålla och felsöka nätverks- och serverinfrastrukturer
  
Ge teknisk support till kunder via fjärr eller på plats hos kund
  
Utföra tekniska utvärderingar och rekommendationer för förbättringar av IT-system
  
  

Om dig
  
För att vi ska trivas och utvecklas ihop är engagemang, målfokus och kundnöjdhet viktigt för dig. Du har kunskaper inom användarsupport, Microsoft 365, Windows Server och nätadministration. Du är en god kommunikatör som kan kommunicera tydligt med både användare och kollegor.
  
  

**Krav:**  

Minst 1–2 års erfarenhet som IT-tekniker
  
Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
  
B-körkort
  
  

Vi erbjuder
  
En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och schyssta arbetsvillkor
  
Fast månadslön
  
Friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimme
  
Tjänstepension och andra förmåner
  
Ett härligt team av kollegor och kunder som uppskattar vårt arbete
  
  

Praktisk information
  
**Placering:** Härnösand
  
**Anställningsform:** Heltid
  
**Start:** Så snart som möjligt
  
**Sista ansökningsdag:** Vi intervjuar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
  
  

**Kontakt:** Har du frågor? Hör av dig till vår HR-konsult, Elin Lantz, på elin.lantz@teamnorr.se eller 070-576 12 13.
  
**Ansökan:** Skicka ditt CV och personliga brev till jobb@teamnorr.se. Märk mejlet med ”IT-tekniker Härnösand”.
  
  

Välkommen till ett team där vi är rejäla och smidiga – på riktigt!

title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
**We Are:**


At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.

 **You Are:**


You are a tech-savvy and passionate Systems Administrator ready to join our European Information Technology team. With a strong foundation in both Windows and Unix operating systems, you are adept at problem-solving and possess a solution-oriented mindset. Your understanding of networking fundamentals and the ability to quickly analyze and respond to situations make you an invaluable asset. You are not only technically proficient but also possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English.


You are preferably located in Sweden, or alternatively in France or Portugal.

 **What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Deploying and managing Windows and Linux PC systems.
* Installing and maintaining network and server equipment.
* Collaborating with IT teams on automation projects for various tasks.
* Providing support for internal teams in Sweden, France, and other locations.
* Traveling to vendor sites and international locations as needed.
* Resolving system-related issues and providing updates to automation processes.

 **The Impact You Will Have:**

* Enhancing the efficiency and reliability of our IT infrastructure.
* Ensuring seamless operation of our systems across multiple locations.
* Contributing to the success of high-visibility projects.
* Improving user experience through effective system support and issue resolution.
* Driving innovation in system automation and deployment.
* Supporting the development and integration of cutting-edge technologies.

 **What You’ll Need:**

* Bachelor’s degree or 2 years equivalent experience within a technology-based program or industry.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and strong logical reasoning.
* Understanding of Windows OS and Unix operating systems, including Linux.
* Excellent English writing and speaking skills.
* Fundamental understanding of TCP/IP networking.
* Ability to analyze situations quickly and respond decisively.
* Experience with common ticket resolution processes and SLAs.
* Ability to articulate technical details clearly and concisely.
* Physical ability to lift 40 pounds occasionally or move a negligible amount frequently.
* Willingness to travel within Europe.

 **Who You Are:**

* Energetic and eager to learn modern technologies.
* A team player who can work independently with minimal supervision.
* Detail-oriented and dedicated to delivering high-quality work.
* Calm under pressure when interacting with internal customers.
* Proactive and positive, embodying the “Yes, If” mindset.

 **The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:**


You will join a dynamic and collaborative team within the European Information Technology department. Our team is responsible for supporting all computing requirements across Europe, ensuring seamless operation and reliability of our systems. We work closely with various IT teams and internal users, driving innovation and efficiency in our IT infrastructure.

 **Rewards and Benefits:**


We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings.
company_description: Synopsys is a valued partner for silicon to systems design across a wide range of vertical markets, empowering technology innovators with the industry’s most comprehensive and trusted solutions.

title: Verification & Data Engineer, Electromobility
description:
**Are you passionate about data, batteries, and contributing to the future of electromobility? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy tackling complex challenges? Then Together Tech is looking for you!**

  

Join the mobility team as a Verification & Data Engineer within electromobility and use your experience to shape the future of electric vehicles. You will be responsible for ensuring the quality and integrity of battery data, contributing directly to data-driven development decisions. You will manage, process, and present data, preparing it for ML/AI implementation and contributing to improved data handling processes. A key aspect of this role involves leveraging your Python programming skills to automate data analysis, processing, and testing procedures, enabling efficient and insightful results.

 **Your technical bakgrund**

* Master's/Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical engineering or
  

related field.
* Professional experience in testing/verification from the automotive industry.
* Extensive professional knowledge in python and data management.
* Good command of written and spoken English, professionally.

**Your personal characteristics**  

Being a consultant puts extra light on having a flexible and curious mindset, a self-reliant way of working and your capability to build strong relationships with customers and colleagues, while keeping track of the target picture. You stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies and are motivated to develop together with us.

  


**Together Tech for sustainability**  

We provide opportunities for development through a variety of assignments in different industries, whether it be client projects or in one of our exciting in-house projects. At Together Tech, you work together with other engineers who are passionate about the environment and sustainability, all with a desire to create lasting solutions using technology - or as we say: Better World Tech!

**Your development & our support**

  

Your development and well-being are important to us, and Together Tech offers benefits that support you and your career in the best way. We value the importance of secure employment and fixed salary, and we have a collective agreement. We prioritize your health and provide a wellness allowance of 4000 SEK per year. Moreover, we offer health check-ups, contributions to activities, and wellness discounts.


We enjoy spending time together through various social activities and team-building activities suitable for everyone! From after-works and sport activities to pentathlons and corporate conferences. Our commitment is to give you great conditions to grow through various assignments and projects as well as individual development plans. We also offer courses in sustainability and other courses within the framework of your role and goals. We take pride in being recognized as one of Sweden's most attractive employers in 2024 and 2025 by Karriärföretagen!

  



Learn more about us at www.togethertech.com.


For questions regarding the position, please contact Business Unit Manager Håkan Rolin, on +46 709 72 71 60.

title: Senior Configuration Manager
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**

  

* Versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
* Hantera och underhålla versionshanteringssystem.
* Säkerställer rätt version i rätt testmiljö.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation för konfiguration, förändringar och releaser. Detta innefattar att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration. CM säkerställer identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
* Ansvarar för att upprätta och implementera konfigurations-hanteringsprocess- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering både mot projekt och förvaltning.
* Analysera omvärlden när olika produkter går end-of-life och samarbetar med plattformsteamen för att planera in behov av byten av infrakomponenter.
* CM samarbetar med utvecklare och andra team för att säkerställa rätt konfiguration av mjukvara och deltar i utveckling- och deployprocessen för att säkerställa kvalité.
* Identifiera och lösa problem relaterade till konfiguration och releaser.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Högskole-/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom IT, data eller systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kunskaper genom erfarenhet.

**Kompetens och erfarenhet:**

* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat som configuration manager inom IT.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från verksamhet med hög skyddsklass involverande samhällskritiska IT-system med hög tillgänglighet och säkerhetskrav under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att säkerställa identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att upprätta process- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Certifiering inom exempelvis Configuration Management II (CMII), Certified Manager Certification (CM) eller liknande
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Azure DevOps och GIT
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ITIL och agila utvecklingsmodeller mervärdeskravet ges 50 kr i prisavdrag på utvärderingspriset)
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av förändringsledning i projekt/program och/eller linjeverksamhet inom IT

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:**28-02-2025  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  


Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

title: Integration Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* **Integration Development:** Design, develop, test, and maintain integrations between the loyalty platform and various systems such as POS, E-commerce, ERP, and Sign-Up Portal.

* **Quality Assurance:** Build and embed quality assurance in everything we do to ensure we deliver a good quality product that meets customers’ requirements and expectations.

* **DevOps Pipeline Management:** Build and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines, incorporating testing and deployment practices that streamline continuous delivery

* **Data Migration:** Work with large data sets to import retailer loyalty data for new market rollouts and export data for operational reporting and business intelligence.

* **Documentation:** Create and maintain clear and comprehensive technical documentation such as API and integration specifications, development guidelines, system architecture diagrams, error handling, security compliance, CI/CD processes and release notes.

* **Performance Monitoring:** Implement tools and processes to monitor the performance of integrations, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability.

* **Collaboration:** Work closely with Product Owners, Technical Leads, Developers, and System Architects to align integration efforts with the overall product strategy and customer engagement goals, contributing to a positive and fun team culture.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

 **Education:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

**Experience:**

* 5+ years of experience in software development with at least three years focused on integration and microservice development.
* Proficient in programming in C# on .NET with familiarity with common programming design principles.
* Proven experience developing REST APIs, webhooks and even-driven integrations using Pub/Sub pattern on Azure Cloud Platform, utilizing ASP.NET.
* Worked on complex DevOps pipelines, including automated QA and deployment.
* Demonstrated experience working with large data sets such as ETL.
* Experience working in large enterprises; experience in Loyalty & Rewards or the Retail sector is a plus.

  


  

  

**Application deadline:** 26-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*
