**Additional Information**
 For this position, we are primarily looking for candidates located in and around the Stockholm region to work in our
 **office in Liljeholmen.** 
 We work from our office 3 days a week.
   

  

* Relocation is not offered for this role\*\*


 Benefits at H&M Group:
   

  

* 6 weeks time off yearly and good work-life balance
* Special discount for our employees in all H&M stores and online worldwide.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market
* Lots of additional perks and discounts from Benify for health and wellbeing
* Ample of focus groups to celebrate diversity and inclusiveness as well as our international culture and events.


**Are you the person we are looking for?** 
 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
Är du redo för att hänga med på vår spännande resa? Ellevio är ett av Sveriges största elnätsbolag och tillsammans fortsätter vi att elektrifiera Sverige. Hos oss är du en del av en trygg och viktig framtidsbransch samtidigt som du får möjlighet att göra skillnad, växa som individ och ha riktigt kul på vägen! Vi tror på en ljus och hållbar framtid, gör du?
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma Ellevios framtida IT-arkitektur?
   

  

 Som Senior Solution Architect hos oss får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra arkitekturbeslut stödjer både affärs- och IT-strategier. Du arbetar nära verksamheten, identifierar behov och tar fram lösningar som är i linje med våra arkitekturstandarder och långsiktiga färdplaner.
   

  

**Om rollen som Senior Solution Architect:**
 I den här rollen blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt arkitekturarbete och kommer att:
   

  

* Utveckla och förbättra Ellevios arkitekturfunktion.
* Dokumentera design och standardmetoder.
* Definiera och uppdatera arkitekturer med vägledande principer och ramar.
* Samarbeta med andra arkitekter för att designa framtidssäkra lösningar.
* Stötta system- och plattformsansvariga i strategisk positionering och färdplanering.
* Konsolidera och skala lösningar för att möta verksamhetens behov.
* Säkerställa att lösningsarkitektur och design möter krav inom affärs-, applikations-, informations- och infrastrukturarkitektur.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, drivande och lösningsorienterad. Du kan ta stort ansvar, arbeta självständigt och säkerställa genomförandet av arkitekturinitiativ. Du har också en god kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i samarbete med olika stakeholders.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera lösningar för stora datamängder på molnplattformar, Azure.
* Förståelse för molnbaserad containerisering i hybridmiljöer, Kubernetes.
* Kunskap om lämpliga datastrukturer och tekniker baserat på affärsbehov.
* Förmåga att påverka och driva lösningsarkitektur från design till genomförande.
* Ett starkt intresse för ny teknik och innovativa arkitekturlösningar.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Ellevio som arbetsgivare**
 Det är viktigt för oss att medarbetare trivs, känner engagemang och drivs av viljan att kontinuerligt lära nytt och utvecklas. Endast då kan vi tillsammans nå vår vision om en ljus och hållbar framtid. Hos oss får du stora möjligheter att både påverka företaget i stort och din egen karriär. Ett fint bevis på det är att vi i år blivit utnämnda till Karriärföretag för femte året i rad!
   

  

 Vi arbetar ständigt för ett hållbart och utvecklande arbetsklimat där jämställdhet, mångfald och inkludering är en självklarhet. Till exempel finns ELLE-nätet, Ellevios interna kvinnliga nätverk, för att skapa förutsättningar för ökad samverkan och trivsel.
   

  

 Om du vill ta reda på mer:
   

  

* Möt några av dina blivande kollegor
* Läs mer om vårt erbjudande till anställda
* Läs mer om vår rekryteringsprocess


**Bra för dig att veta!**
 Vi vill tillsätta våra tjänster så snart vi hittar en bra match och därför rekommenderar vi dig att inte vänta med att skicka in din ansökan. Gillar du det du har läst hittills och vill vara med på vår resa framåt – skicka in ditt CV eller Linkedinprofil senast den 21 februari.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef José Da Silva på Jose.Dasilva@ellevio.se. Vid frågor gällande ansökningsprocessen kontakta rekryteringsansvarig Gabriella Boumadi på Gabriella.Boumadi@ellevio.se
   

  

 Då vi är en samhällsviktig verksamhet genomför vi alltid bakgrundskontroller på samtliga slutkandidater. Om den aktuella tjänsten är inplacerad i säkerhetsklass genomför vi, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585,) en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll innan anställning. Om du söker en tjänst hos oss som kan komma att krigsplaceras får du information om det i samband med din anställning.
   

  

 Ansök

title: Senior Configuration Manager
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
* Hantera och underhålla versionshanteringssystem.
* Säkerställer rätt version i rätt testmiljö.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation för konfiguration, förändringar och releaser. Detta innefattar att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration. CM säkerställer identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
* Ansvarar för att upprätta och implementera konfigurations-hanteringsprocess- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering både mot projekt och förvaltning.
* Analysera omvärlden när olika produkter går end-of-life och samarbetar med plattformsteamen för att planera in behov av byten av infrakomponenter.
* CM samarbetar med utvecklare och andra team för att säkerställa rätt konfiguration av mjukvara och deltar i utveckling- och deployprocessen för att säkerställa kvalité.
* Identifiera och lösa problem relaterade till konfiguration och releaser.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskole-/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom IT, data eller systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kunskaper genom erfarenhet.


**Kompetens Och Erfarenhet**
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat som configuration manager inom IT.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av versionshantering av mikrotjänster, tjänster, produkter och system.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från verksamhet med hög skyddsklass involverande samhällskritiska IT-system med hög tillgänglighet och säkerhetskrav under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att dokumentera systemets och produkternas konfiguration.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att säkerställa identifiering, spårbarhet, ändringshantering, status på kravuppfyllnad och ser till att korrekt information är tillgänglig under systemets och produkternas hela livscykler.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ansvara för att upprätta process- och säkerhetsrutiner för konfigurationshantering.


**Meriterande**
* Certifiering inom exempelvis Configuration Management II (CMII), Certified Manager Certification (CM) eller liknande
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Azure DevOps och GIT
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ITIL och agila utvecklingsmodeller mervärdeskravet ges 50 kr i prisavdrag på utvärderingspriset)
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av förändringsledning i projekt/program och/eller linjeverksamhet inom IT


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 28-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Analytics Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, General Business, and Engineering
company_industry: Software Development, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and Internet Marketplace Platforms
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





 Ready for a new adventure building the next-generation retail experience? As an Analytics Engineer at Bambuser, you’ll be an integral part of our data team. You will focus on building scalable analytics workflows, maintaining and developing key dashboards, and solving complex analytical problems in a scalable manner. You’ll take part in driving our analytics strategy, ensuring data quality and availability across the business. In this role, you will have a visible impact by creating data products that directly influence the business, customers, and product insights.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Build and maintain analytics tables to ensure data is easily accessible and actionable.
* Develop and maintain key dashboards in ThoughtSpot and other BI tools to serve key business insights to internal teams.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineering, Product, and Customer Success Management (CSM), to deliver actionable insights.
* Solve complex analytical challenges and provide scalable, high-quality data solutions (ie: attribution modeling).
* Contribute to the development of Bambuser's data strategy, including the improvement of our "golden data sets" and other key initiatives.
* Drive improvements in data quality and availability, helping the company make data-driven decisions.
* Build and optimize data products exposed to our customers, impacting their experience and success.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





 Mid-level to senior experience, with a proven track record in analytics engineering, data warehousing, or a similar role. Experience with GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow) is preferred but not required.
 



  





  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Proficient in SQL and familiar with transformation tools such as Dataform or dbt.
* Experience with Python, or similar, and an understanding of cloud platforms, particularly GCP (Google Cloud Platform), is a plus.
* Familiarity with event-driven architectures.
* Experience with BI tools (e.g., ThoughtSpot, Looker) and a desire to create meaningful, visually appealing insights.



  





  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* High stakeholder engagement: You will regularly interface with both technical and non-technical teams across the business.
* Familiarity with e-commerce or streaming data in an event-driven architecture is a plus.
* Strong communication skills with an ability to explain technical solutions to non-technical audiences.



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





 Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.

title: Senior IP Cloud Network Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Want to embark on a new career journey where you can make a real impact? I'm Marko Onikki, and I'm searching for a curious individual like you, ready to leave a lasting mark. Join our team, where your skills will thrive, and together – let's make better happen!
   

  

**As a Cloud IP Network DevOps Engineer…**
 You will continue to evolve our network cloud platform and do this by using the latest technologies in this area. You’ll be part of the Connectivity & Delivery Team, responsible for building Cloud infrastructure and providing connectivity to our customers in Telia’s Network Cloud footprint in Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Lithuania, Norway and Sweden. Our team works with the HW/SW components of the cloud stack including IP connectivity to the tenant applications. This is a great opportunity for a candidate to grow and contribute to our softwarization journey.
   

  

 You will be responsible for developing and maintaining Telia’s cloud-based IP network solutions. Your role will involve designing, implementing, and supporting network infrastructure to ensure high availability and scalability. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver advanced network solutions, drive automation initiatives, and optimize operations.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a proactive and technically skilled professional with a strong background in IP networking and cloud environments. You are forward-thinking and adaptable, with a passion for continuous improvement and collaboration in a DevOps setting.
   

  

 You bring extensive experience with IP network solutions, including routing and switching, and a solid understanding of private cloud technologies (VMware) and processes. Your hands-on expertise with utilizing Infrastructure as Code to automate operations (IaC/config mgmt tools (Ansible, Terraform), APIs (REST API, gRPC), CICD tools (Jenkins), Version control (Git, Github), containerization (Docker, Podman). Additionally, you are proficient in scripting languages and programming languages such as Python or Bash and Sys administration (RHEL, Centos, Ubuntu). Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is required.
   

  

 Knowledge of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, HHTP/HTTPS, SSL, BGP, MPLS) and VPN technologies, as well as an understanding of network security principles (FW, ACL), is also important. Experience with container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Docker would be a valuable asset. CCIE or at least CCNP certified ideally in Service Provider track or Routing & Switching / Enterprise. Relevant knowledge/experience is also a qualifier. Fluent English in both speaking and writing is necessary.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-03-04. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at marko.onikki@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: Staff Cybersecurity Architect, Governance
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of mobile apps, connectivity platform and a connected appliance.
   

  

**We’re looking for a Staff Cybersecurity Architect to join us on our journey.**
**What you’ll do:**
 Contribute to defining cybersecurity and privacy governance model for Electrolux Digital Experience (DX), with focus on processes and guardrails and their reflection in Electrolux digital products; formulate, evangelize, drive stakeholder alignment and support execution of a long-term strategy in the area of cybersecurity and privacy governance for connected products.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Formulate, maintain, evangelize and drive adoption of technical guardrails, policies and processes in the area of cybersecurity-and-privacy governance across the Digital Experience organization; drive approval by stakeholders (Group CISO, Group Compliance, Data Privacy Office, Digital Technology management); engage in detailed formulation of cybersecurity controls within the commercial-launch process of connected appliances, in alignment with the Digital Process & Tools Excellence function and other;
* Support automation of cybersecurity governance by formulation of control sets for connected products and help instrumentation of tooling for control-set application and risk tracking; help define, align with stakeholders and drive automation and adoption of cybersecurity Incident-response and Disaster-recovery processes across Digital Experience;
* Follow globally evolving best practices and regulatory requirements in the area of governance for cybersecurity and privacy for connected products, such as OWASP, NIS-2, ISO and others; assess their implications towards architecture and processes relating to Electrolux Digital Products; continuously evangelize within the organization; represent in formulating Electrolux feedback to governing bodies where applicable;
* Continuously assess status of Electrolux Digital Experience organization with respect to cybersecurity and privacy governance; drive internal DX processes and infrastructure to ensure governance; engage with DX Digital Products to influence architecture improvements; support governance audits of Digital Products and assist to external and internal audits assessing compliance;
* Carry out cybersecurity reviews and propose architecture improvements, ensure Security by design working together with other Architects, Engineers, Developers and Product Managers;
* Identify and communicate current and emerging Cybersecurity threats and Cybersecurity and Privacy gaps in existing and proposed architectures, recommend remedies or enhancements; ensure compliance to standards, policies and best practices;
* Serve as DX interface to Cybersecurity governance stakeholders, such as group CISO, Data Privacy Office, Digital Process &Tools Excellence and other functions, in formulation of long-term strategy in the area of cybersecurity and privacy governance ; track, evangelize and promote cybersecurity best practices.


**Who you are:**
* You must have strong understanding of core cybersecurity principles and state-of-the-art IoT ecosystems’ architecture;
* Expertise is necessary in some of the advanced cybersecurity and privacy topics: security hardening; cybersecurity and privacy protection in embedded, cloud or mobile systems; data protection at rest and in transit; identity and access management; security threat modelling and risk assessment; cybersecurity testing; cybersecurity and privacy legislation and regulatory frameworks (RED, NIS-2, CRA and the like);
* Strong knowledge of information security standards, codes of practice and guidelines such as ISO/IEC 27001, NIST Computer Security or OWASP; professional certification such as CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CCNA; strong knowledge and awareness of corporate governance, related business processes, and control objectives, understanding of cybersecurity and privacy audit procedures;
* You have experience in cybersecurity governance from a large global organization, developing and maintaining cyber security policies, procedures, controls, guidelines and standards, protecting the organizations assets, and ensuring that resources are managed efficiently and controlled effectively. Experience with Agile development methods and Continuous integration tools such as Atlassian SaaS or Jenkins is an advantage;
* 5+ years of experience in cybersecurity governance aspects of digital product development, operation and maintenance; Master's Degree in Computer Science or Electronic Engineering, or comparable experience. PhD and/or cybersecurity specialization, is a plus.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.
* Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations.
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our hub in Warsaw (Poland); exceptional candidates may also be considered for the Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) or for Prague (Czech Republic). Regardless of the chosen location, you will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:**
 Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Solution Architect Competence Center Sustainability
description:

title: It-arkitekt med fokus på lösningsarkitektur, i Luleå
description:
Placeringsort Flera orterDiarienummer FK 2025/004731
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 24 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största it-avdelningar.*
 Lösningsarkitekt, stora utvecklingsuppdrag
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta som lösningsarkitekt i hela flödet från verksamhetsbehov till leverans i olika utvecklingsuppdrag. Där ansvarar du för
   

  

 att ta fram och kvalitetssäkra lösningsarkitekturen samt att driva förflyttningen av it-stödet enligt vår målarkitektur. Du kommer även
   

  

 arbeta med att utveckla it-arkitekturen, bland annat genom att ta fram referensarkitektur, mönster och modeller inom olika
   

  

 arkitekturdomäner.
   

  

 Ett viktigt mål är att it-arkitekturen leder till verksamhetsnytta. För att lyckas håller du dig hela tiden insatt i Försäkringskassans
   

  

 inriktning och organisationens behov. Du följer även trender inom it-arkitektur både inom systemutveckling och infrastruktur.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har erfarenhet av arbete i egenutvecklingsprojekt som lösningsarkitekt eller mjukvaruarkitekt
* har flerårig erfarenhet inom agil systemutveckling
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* är trygg och förtroendeingivande, även i belastade situationer
* kan förstå och analysera komplexa frågor
* har god organisatorisk förståelse och kan omsätta denna i verksamheten
* har förmåga att få gehör för planer och idéer på ett framgångsrikt sätt
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i tal och skrift
* har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har en certifiering som it-arkitekt
* har god ledarskapsförmåga och kan fatta beslut
* har erfarenhet av utveckling av containerbaserade microservice-lösningar
* har erfarenhet av utveckling i RedHat OpenShift-miljö
* har flerårig erfarenhet som mjukvaruarkitekt eller kodutvecklare och gärna på flera olika plattformar.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 En tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsort: Sundsvall, Karlskrona eller Luleå.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Marcus Sällstedt, 010-112 73 94 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Klas Lindblad 010-113 10 43 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Simo Dzeletovic, Saco-S Ann Wiström, Seko Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 13 mars 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id kontaktar du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen via telefon så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.

title: SAP Enterprise Architect
description:
**We (Westernacher Consulting)** 
 are a global SAP consulting leader, specializing in providing services related to business transformation, digital transformation, and technology solutions.
   

  

 As an
 **SAP Enterprise Architect** 
 , you will be responsible for defining and managing the architecture for SAP solutions on transformational projects. This includes aligning SAP solutions with business goals, ensuring seamless the integration of existing IT systems, and overseeing the overall design of SAP environments. You will work closely with business and IT leaders to optimize SAP capabilities and lead SAP transformation initiatives.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Architecture Design: Develop architectural governance, roadmaps, and implementation plans to guide the execution of technology initiatives.
* System Integration: Lead the integration of SAP with other enterprise systems and ensure compatibility with legacy applications.
* Strategy and Planning: Collaborate with customers, business stakeholders, and technology teams to understand business objectives, identify opportunities, and define technology strategies aligned with SAP's product portfolio.
* SAP S/4HANA: Design end-to-end enterprise solutions that meet business requirements, considering scalability, performance, security, and integration aspects.
* Technology Evaluation: Assess and introduce new technologies and solutions to improve SAP functionalities and business performance.
* Governance and Best Practices: Establish architectural guidelines and standards, ensuring compliance with SAP best practices and company policies.
* Team Leadership: Guide a team of SAP specialists, developers, and business analysts, ensuring collaboration and effective implementation of solutions.


**Your Skills**
* Experience: Minimum 8-10 years of experience in one or more Functional Domains with a proven project record in any of the following areas where you acted as enterprise architect: Finance and Controlling, Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management, Order to Cash.
* Knowledge: SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework and Toolset, and experience with BTP components and services such as application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI capabilities.
* Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. SAP certification is a plus.
* Skills: Strong understanding of enterprise architecture frameworks, excellent problem-solving skills, and experience in project management.
* Tools: Familiarity with SAP Solution Manager, SAP Cloud Platform, and SAP integration tools.
* Communication: Excellent communication, influencing, and negotiation skills in Swedish and English (other languages are an advantage), at C-level.


**Westernacher's Promise**

* Competitive compensation & benefits.

We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.
   

  

 Living, working, and operating in partnership. We are inquisitive, creative thinkers with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We question new ways of working, think differently and are willing to try out new approaches to create value and innovation for our customers. All of this makes us pioneers in our field and keeps us responsive, quality-focused and results-oriented.
   

  

 Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Lönekonsult
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Human Resources Services
description:
**JOB TITLE: Lönekonsult**
**Placering:** 
**Östermalmtorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**
**Hybrid**
**Om ADP Sverige AB**
**Välkommen till ADP Sverige AB, vi har öppnat vårt första kontor i Norden i september 2023 och befinner oss i en tillväxtperiod där vi satsar på att utöka vårt team i våra kontorslokaler på Östermalm. Vi erbjuder ett ständigt utvecklande arbete med spännande kunder i en global miljö. ADP finns i ett stort antal länder i hela världen och en av de största aktörerna inom löneoutsourcing med digitala HR-lösningar och arbetar ständigt med AI lösningar för att säkra och utveckla våra leveranser.**
**Rollbeskrivning**
**I din roll kommer du att;**
 Vara en rådgivande part till våra kunder, säkerställa att aktuella lagar och regelverk efterföljs.
   

  

 Eget kundansvar
   

  

 Vi är ett team som samarbetar och kompletterar varandras styrkor och kompetenser inom alla olika områden såsom pensioner, svenska lagar och kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer Och Personliga Egenskaper**
* Erfarenhet av självständigt lönearbete, minst 2 år. Gärna inom outsourcingbranschen och hanterat hela processen, från ax till limpa.
* Utbildning, eftergymnasial utbildning inom lön lönespecialist/lönekonsult
* God systemvana, lönesystem, tid och-resa, samt övriga ärendehanteringssystem, vi använder oss av Hogia Lön +
* Goda kunskaper av Excel
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift
* Serviceminded, självgående och lösningsorienterad
* Teamplayer
* Integritet
* GDPR


**Rollbeskrivning -Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Säkerställa korrekt och punktlig lönehantering i enlighet med avtalade deadlines och kundens behov.
* Fungera som primär kontaktperson för kunder och leverera högkvalitativ service samt sakkunnig rådgivning inom löneområdet.
* Tolka och tillämpa kollektivavtal samt företagsspecifika policys och riktlinjer.
* Uppdatera och underhålla dokumentation, processbeskrivningar och interna rutiner för att säkerställa kontinuerlig effektivitet och efterlevnad.
* Arbeta proaktivt med planering och prioritera arbetsuppgifter för att optimera arbetsflöden och leveranser. Hantera lönejusteringar, korrigeringar samt uppdateringar av löner i enlighet med gällande lagar och bestämmelser.
* Bidra till teamets gemensamma mål genom ett lösningsorienterat och samarbetsinriktat arbetssätt
* Tillhandahålla professionellt stöd och rådgivning till kunder i specifika lönefrågor.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
**ADP är en inkluderande organisation,**
* Hybrid, 3-2
* Generös friskvårdsbidrag
* Flextid
* 39 timmars veckoarbetstid
* Tjänstepension
* Var dig själv i en kultur som värdesätter rättvisa, inkludering och tillhörighet och ger utrymme för olika perspektiv och insikter.
* Tillhörighet gå med i en av tio Business Resource Groups där du kan ansluta globalt med nätverk och allierade som delar gemensamma intressen och erfarenheter.
* Goda karriärmöjligheter i en dynamisk miljö med många möjligheter att utvecklas.
* Var din hälsosammaste genom bra förmåner från dag 1.
* Fokus på mental hälsa och välmående vi är här för att ge exceptionell service till våra kunder, och inget av det händer utan att var och en av oss tar hand om oss själva och finns där för varandra.
* Arbeta på ett förtag som är dedikerad att ge tillbaka och skapa en varaktig, positiv inverkan på de samhällen där vi arbetar och lever.
* Ge tillbaka betald ledighet volontärarbete för ändamål


**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Senior Mathematical Optimisation Engineer
description:
**Do you have** **expertise** **in, and passion for** **O****perations** **R****esearch** **and** **AI****?** Would you like to apply your modelling expertise in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the place for you!

  

Join us as Senior Mathematical Optimisation Engineer at our vibrant site in Gothenburg, Sweden.

 **Disrupt an industry and change lives**


At AstraZeneca we are dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development.


Working in Technology here means you will be a self-starter who is comfortable stepping up and taking ownership, willing to constantly explore and challenge the status quo. You will be empowered to orchestrate new possibilities, solve challenges, push boundaries, and continuously innovate. We impact patients’ lives. Empowering and enabling the business to run more efficiently, we play a part in improving lives across the world!

 **What you´ll do**


The ideal candidate will have proven expertise and experience in designing, developing, and supporting mathematical optimisation, simulation, and/or machine learning systems end-to-end across a wide range of business problems.


The position will involve working on the most exciting and hardest Operations Research and AI engineering problems in the pharmaceutical industry. You will work within a global team of deeply technical Operations Research engineers, AI engineers, and software developers. You will contribute to the design, development, and support of tools that will transform how AstraZeneca operates at scale, making us more efficient in our goal to improve the lives of millions of patients across the globe.

 **Key Accountabilities**

* Contribute to design and development of end-to-end Operations Research or AI solutions for the business.
* Visualise complex datasets and model outputs using the latest front-end technologies.
* Work together with senior optimisation engineers and AI engineers in the team, focussed on product delivery and support.
* Liaise with other engineers to enhance our technological stack, to enable the adoption of the latest advances in software engineering.
* Contribute to various solutions and applications that may cover a broad range of business areas, sometimes at once.
* Be self-driven, curious, innovative, deeply technical and learn continuously.
 **Essential for the role**

* PhD or MSc in Operations Research, Computer Science, or a related quantitative subject.
* 5+ years of experience and demonstrable technical skills in developing prescriptive and predictive solutions for complex real-world problems.
* Proven, hands-on coding experience, and
* Demonstrated experience using mathematical optimisation software such as CPLEX, Gurobi, XPRESS or OR-Tools.
* A working knowledge of optimisation concepts.
* Proficient programmer, ideally with a background in Python.
* A track record of understanding and translating complex business problems into engineering problems.
* Knowledge of software development best practices and deployment practices such as CI/CD, testing, version control.
* Ability to explain and present concepts and results to a broad audience.
* Creative, collaborative, & product focused.
 **Desirable for the role**

* Hands-on experience in developing interactive AI applications (e.g., full-stack apps).
* Experience in the deployment of AI tools.
 **So,** **what’s** **next?**

  

Be part of something where your work directly impacts a big purpose: to develop life-changing medicines. Join Us!

  

We look forward to reviewing your application. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than **March 16.**
company_description: Build unrivalled capabilities in a place that promotes learning agility and offers development opportunities. We never standstill so you’ll have the chance to constantly grow your abilities.

title: Lead Mechanical Engineer
description:
**Lead Mechanical Engineer** **-** **KUN0030****Company****:** Worley**Primary Location****:** SWE-BO-Kungälv**Job****:** Mechanical**Schedule****:** Full-time**Employment Type****:** Employee**Job Level****:** Experienced**Job Posting****:** Feb 20, 2025**Unposting Date****:** Mar 22, 2025**Reporting Manager Title****:** Department Manager • Process/Mechanical and DHSE
: **Building on our past. Ready for the future**



Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts. We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets. We’re bridging two worlds, moving towards more sustainable energy sources, while helping to provide the energy, chemicals and resources needed now.


**The Role:**  

We are looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our teams in Stenungsund and Kungälv. In this role, you will provide mechanical engineering services to Worley and our customers, ensuring projects meet safety, quality, and regulatory standards. You’ll lead project requirements, manage scope and procurement, and collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects on time and within budget.


**You Will:**


* Lead mechanical engineering activities, ensuring compliance with safety standards, project requirements, and industry codes.
* Provide technical guidance on Static, Rotating, and Package Equipment (e.g., heat exchangers, pressure vessels, pumps, dosing systems).
* Manage project scope, changes, and procurement, including preparing requisitions, evaluations, and purchase orders.
* Prepare design documents, specifications, and reports while monitoring project budgets, schedules, and staffing.
* Coordinate with other disciplines during design, construction, and startup phases to ensure alignment.
* Visit suppliers for meetings, testing, and clarifications as needed.
* Communicate effectively with the team, stakeholders, and customers, providing leadership and mentoring to engineers to ensure high-quality work.


**You Bring:**


* Extensive experience in mechanical engineering with a strong background in leadership and team management.
* A degree in mechanical engineering or a related field.
* Strong knowledge of mechanical principles and relevant software.
* In-depth knowledge of international codes and standards, especially related to pressure equipment and design (e.g., PED, ASME Sec 8 Div 1, EN13445).
* Experience working on multi-disciplinary projects.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with Swedish as a plus.
* A collaborative, team-oriented mindset.
**Moving forward together**



We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone feels they belong, can bring themselves, and are heard. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by law.



We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.



And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.



Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

title: CAM Manufacturing Engineer - Additive Manufacturing
description:
Jobbeskrivning


As a key member of our small, dynamic team you will play a vital role in advancing method and technology development while contributing to the creation of innovative demonstrators. Our team supports a broader organization by tackling machining-related challenges, engaging in diverse research projects, and collaborating with leading companies and universities.


Your primary focus will be on CAM engineering, but your responsibilities will be tailored to your unique skills and expertise. You will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art hardware and software, shaping the development of cutting-edge PLM and CAD/CAM environments while driving improvements to existing standards. This role emphasizes developing strategies for Additive Manufacturing, though prior experience in this field is not required—it’s a bonus.


If you're eager to push the boundaries of CAM engineering and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you!


Job Responsibilities:

* Actively contribute as a collaborative team member.
* Partner with Senior Research Engineers in national and EU-funded projects.
* Interpret and understand customer requirements, including technical drawings and specifications related to manufacturing.
* Collaborate with design and engineering teams to review CAD models and technical drawings, providing feedback to enhance manufacturability and improve processes across projects.
* Develop and implement CAM programs for CNC machines, including Powder and Wire Deposition of metallic materials used in Additive Manufacturing.
* Design innovative machining setups and establish flexible, low-volume machining strategies.
* Create and optimize tool paths, machining strategies, and tooling solutions to improve efficiency and performance.
* Conduct simulations and analyses to validate CAM programs, ensuring compliance with quality and safety standards.
* Train and mentor CAM engineers, offering technical guidance and support.
* Stay informed about advancements in CAM software and manufacturing technologies, applying new knowledge to enhance processes.

  


Kvalifikationer


* Proven experience in manufacturing and production processes.
* Preferably, expertise in NC programming, particularly using NX software.
* Extensive hands-on experience in manufacturing and operating machining equipment.
* Open-minded with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
* Strong interpersonal skills, adaptability, and an independent work style to thrive in collaborative settings.
* Proficiency in English is required; Swedish language skills are a plus.
* A positive attitude with a willingness to share knowledge and train others.

  


Företagsbeskrivning


*AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.*


Ytterligare information


Welcome with your application!


Stefan Hellqvist - Section Manager  

stefan.hellqvist@afry.com


Anders Kristiansen - Recruiter  

anders.a.kristiansen@afry.com

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*


Apply information

CAM Manufacturing Engineer - Additive Manufacturing

Trollhättan

Sweden

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Platform Engineer**

Want to be part of shaping data governance at Telia and building Telia’s metadata management platform? We are now looking for an **engineer for Data Governance and Privacy Operations team** in our Technology IT organization an exciting opportunity to join the journey to strengthen our data catalog and data lineage capabilities and help organization to unleash the power of data.


The Data Governance & Privacy Operations team is responsible for building, securing and maintaining data governance & privacy at Telia which supported by our data governance tool suite. We play a key part in building the enterprise data catalog for Telia Company.


**As a Platform Engineer you will…**

You will have a key role in the data governance team in supporting the **technical vision** , **roadmap** , and **design** for our **data governance** tool stack in collaborating with the product owner and engineers. You will collaborate with stakeholders and play an important part in building target capabilities for the data governance tool suite and scaling of the tool suite within the organization.


Your responsibilities will include supporting the Product Owner and Lead Engineer in achieving the vision and roadmap for the Data Governance tool suite, which includes the data catalog, data lineage, business glossary, and data quality. You will actively participate in **solution design, technical development** , and **troubleshooting** of the **data catalog** . Additionally, you will handle maintenance, troubleshoot issues, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure uninterrupted system performance and usability. Furthermore, you will stay updated on the latest market trends and industry best practices to continuously refine and update the technical vision. You will work with a wide set of stakeholders including software engineers, product owners, delivery leads, solution architects, data engineers and data architects.


We are on a journey to become the new generation telco, and we believe that we can offer you an interesting opportunity where you will take part in continuous learning, work on improvements with your colleagues, and have fun along the way!


**Who we’re looking for**

You are someone self-driven who is **passionate about data** and **engineering** . You can express your vision clearly and have earlier experience in designing technical solutions. You are communicative and enjoy working in collaboration with multiple stakeholders to define needs and requirements.


You are a self-driven and motivated professional who understands and anticipates stakeholder needs, demonstrating this in your proposed solutions. You approach problems in a structured and collaborative manner, identifying both short- and long-term solutions. Your curiosity enables you to quickly acquire new knowledge and apply it effectively, while you actively seek and act on feedback to enhance solution quality.


With **3+** years of experience working with **enterprise-level IT solutions** , you have expert proficiency in **Python** and **Kubernetes** . You bring strong knowledge and experience in **PySpark** , **Java** , **Airflow** , **Unix** , and open-source solutions. Your background includes solution design and integrating various technologies such as **REST** **APIs** , **Java** , **Python** , and **JSON** . Experience with **GitHub** , **Airflow** , and **AWS** is considered a plus. Additionally, you have a solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, including data modeling, data architecture, and data ingestion methods and practices. You possess professional proficiency in both spoken and written English.


(Monthly salary range for this position: 3 043 - 4 565 EUR before tax deduction. This range is applicable for candidates based in Lithuania).


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We´re looking forward to your application by 20/03/2025. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed


Got questions? Please reach out to Augustas Degutis ( augustas.degutis@teliacompany.com ) or Shifan Mihilar ( shifan.mihilar@teliacompany.com ).


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Diagnostic System Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Be responsible for the requirements analysis based on OBD legislation, ISO standard, OEM requirements and FMEA.
* Design the monitor strategy with stable robustness.
* Compile the diagnostic requirements in software level and component level.
* Design the diagnostic architecture combining with the application software and basic software.
* Interact with system engineer, BSW engineer and hardware engineer about the diagnostic function.
* Support in development of unit design.
* Compile the deliveries as OBD Certification Documents, Fault Handling Specification.
* Support the diagnostic test plan and test cases.
* Issue analysis with test team about the diagnostic function validation.
* Support the interaction between Diagnostic and FuSa.


**Requirements**


* Good knowledge of OBDII, EOBD, J1979, J2012, ISO14229.
* Good understanding on FMEA/FTA and shall be able to perform diagnostic analysis.
* Experience in diagnostic monitor design about hybrid transmission.
* Familiar with AUTOSAR, especially DEM, FIM.
* Solid understanding of electrified transmissions and electric drive units.
* Experience in diagnostic work methodology /Audits/ Assessments.

title: System Design Engineer – Brake Control & Vehicle Motion
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Work with the function designer/owner in the team.
* Work with other stakeholders (e.g. concept design for autonomous emergency braking).
* Design the solutions using Simulink (simulate when valuable).
* Update the architecture with new CAN signals. Break down legal requirements.
* Work together with the in-house software teams and testing teams.
* Update a subpart of the technical safety concept.

**Requirements**


* Relevant work experience.
* Engineering degree (or other relevant).
* Driver’s license type B.
* You must be able to design.

title: Lead Engineer – Calibration & Performance Optimization
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Lead the calibration activities for powertrain control systems, including electric drive units.
* Develop and optimize calibration strategies for key performance areas such as torque delivery, efficiency, and drivability.
* Develop Calibration Processes and Ensure seamless integration of calibration activities within the Automotive SPICE (ASPICE) and V-Model development framework.
* Conduct vehicle and test bench evaluations to validate calibration changes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software, hardware, and system engineers, to achieve performance targets.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards for emissions, safety, and energy efficiency.
* Implement and refine calibration tools and methodologies for improved accuracy and efficiency.
* Analyze test data and provide recommendations to improve vehicle performance.
* Coordinate and lead root cause analysis for issues identified during calibration activities.
* Develop calibration documentation and guidelines for internal knowledge sharing.
* Ensure that calibration processes adhere to ISO 26262 requirements for functional safety.
* Implement secure calibration workflows to mitigate cybersecurity risks related to software manipulation.


**Requirements**


* Powertrain Systems Knowledge – Expertise in electric drive units (EDUs), hybrid systems, and conventional powertrains.
* Calibration Tools – Proficiency in Vector CANape, ETAS INCA, MATLAB, Simulink, and DiagRA D.
* Control Systems – Strong understanding of closed-loop control strategies and vehicle dynamics.
* Data Analysis – Ability to interpret calibration data, identify trends, and optimize system behavior.
* Software & Development Processes – Knowledge of ASPICE, V-Model, Agile, and Model-Based Development (MBD).
* Testing & Validation – Experience in HiL, SiL, and vehicle-level testing for calibration verification.
* Diagnostic & Fault Analysis – Experience with OBD-II, UDS, and failure mode analysis.
* Regulatory Compliance – Understanding of automotive standards related to emissions, safety, and cybersecurity.
* Version Control & Data Management – Experience with Git, SVN, or similar tools for calibration versioning.

title: Verification Engineer - Car Service Business
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**
-------------------------------

  

  

We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



The purpose of Car Service Business is to enable an effortless car usage and service experience. The automotive industry is currently undergoing a significant transformation driven by changing consumer behaviours, technology shifts, and digitalization. The team, System Support within Car Service Business is responsible for making life less complicated for consumers.  

How? Secure quality in software through testing with a customer-value-perspective, to provide a effort-less experience for workshops and customers.


**What you'll do**
------------------



We are looking for a Software Verification Engineer to join our Test & validation team.


Your responsibility is to secure the quality of software downloads with VIDA as a tool for new car projects as well backwards compatible in previous car models.  



* Developing and performing tests both in vehicle and software based.
* Support in early-verification car programs.
* Support in software releases by validating quality.
* Reduce software download error rates.
* Report deviations from test results.
* Contribute to further development of application release processes.
* Participate in early phases of development to support with testing.

  




Since we are working with testing and validation in the vehicles based only in our office at Torslanda, this position require fully on-site availability.  



**What you'll bring**
---------------------



You hold a university degree in Computer Engineering or Software Engineering and have accumulated several years of experience in embedded systems, particularly within the automotive sector.  

Your expertise extends to vehicle electrical architecture, and you possess a European driving license, enabling you to test drive vehicles as part of your role.  

Additionally, your precision in testing and validation processes guarantees high-quality outcomes, making you an asset in ensuring the reliability and performance of automotive software and systems.  



On a personal level, you are well-structured and approach your tasks with a strong analytical mindset. As a team player with a positive attitude, you excel in communication and collaborate effectively with others.  

Your adaptability allows you to thrive in various situations and meet specific needs, making you well-suited for an international work environment. You possess a strong customer focus, demonstrating courage and the ability to balance the interests of multiple stakeholders. These competencies are crucial for success in this role.  




**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Pedram Yousefi at pedram.yousefi@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Jacob Pettersson at jacob.pettersson@volvocars.com.

  

  

 Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until **9th of Mars 2025**. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: Maps Services Lead Engineer
description:
**Summary**  

  

Posted: Dec 20, 2024
  

  

Weekly Hours: **37.5**
  

  

Role Number:**200583487**  

  

Are you a self-starter looking for an exciting career opportunity? Do you like to ship software solutions that impact Apple Maps users around the world? Are you passionate about leading complex software engineering work? A job at Apple is unlike any other you’ve had. You’ll be challenged, inspired, and you will be proud of your work. Maps are a significant part of our everyday lives. Whether you are selecting a fine restaurant for dinner with friends, finding public transit that gets you to the big game before kickoff, or looking for the nearest gas station, you are relying on services provided by the Maps Services Team. The Apple Maps Services team develop cutting-edge guidance products to constantly improve the navigation experience and help hundreds of millions of people every day with their driving, walking and public transit needs. The team is also responsible for generating the vector maps that powers the beautiful map display in Apple Maps. We are looking for a skilled lead software engineer, with a passion to take ownership of problems and deliverables, lead software engineering work, and to organise skilled engineers to deliver the next generation of display and navigation services for Apple Maps.
  

  

**Description**  

  

- Lead and drive the work of a team of remarkably skilled software engineers. - Be a strong advocate for the customer experience. - Take ownership of solving problems and deliver solutions on time. -Communicate and coordinate with teams and stakeholders in the US. - Participating in design and code reviews. - Influencing the future product direction.
  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Ability to take ownership, identify requirements, prioritise and make progress in an environment with limited given input.
* Very strong in leading others, and hands-on, in programming, system design and problem solving.
* Extensive, professional experience from software engineering.
* Fluent communication in English with a sense for listening to others as well as getting your message through in a crisp way.
* Experience in cross team collaboration and communication across multiple timezones.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Strong understanding of common data structures and basic graph algorithms.
* Mindset of writing efficient code, recognising that the "optimal solution" may not always be the most efficient if its impact is minimal.
* Experience in Scala, Python, Kotlin, and C++.
* Knowledge in Spark, Iceberg and spatial algorithms/problems.
* Experience from working in distributed engineering teams.
* Knowledge from the maps (GIS) domain, related to routing, navigation, traffic or display maps.
* Experience from the ML domain.

title: Test Automations Ingenjör inom mjukvara
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker en Test Automations ingenjör inom mjukvara som vill hjälpa våra kunder inom Q/A området nära inbyggda system.



Du har ett genuint intresse för teknikutveckling och vi tror att du på fritiden håller dig uppdaterad inom branschen. Din passion för teknik, människan och affären driver dig att ständigt utforska nya lösningar och möjligheter.



Som Test Automation ingenjör på Sigma Industry Development kommer du att hjälpa våra kunder med att driva strategier och samtidigt vara hands-on inom:


* testramverksutveckling där Python är primära språket
* skriva testfall inom kundens domänområde
* underhålla ramverk och test automations pipe
* programmering med Python
* vana att använda byggsystem och ramverk för mjukvarutestning
* vana att jobba med Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
* vana att jobba med kvalitativ versionskontroll för källkodshantering ex. GitHub eller GitLab
* vana att jobba med nightly test & daily test ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI eller Travis CI
* vana att jobba med orkestrering och container teknologier såsom Docker

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker dig som vill vara nära tekniken hands-on.


* Ca 5 års professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system
* Lång erfarenhet och intresse av att delvis jobba i lab-miljö med kombinationen hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Minst 4 års professionell erfarenhet inom Test Automation området nära R&D och inbyggda system med Python som primärt språk
* Lång erfarenhet som mjukvarutestare i större projekt där produkten innefattar hårdvara och mjukvara
* Erfarenhet av flertalet Linux distributioner för inbyggda system
* Meriterande med professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system med C/C++ som primärt språk
* Säkerhet – Förståelse för bästa praxis inom säkerhet för infrastruktur och applikationer.
* Nätverk – Kännedom om nätverkskoncept i Linux miljö.
* Agila metoder – Kännedom om agila ramverk som Scrum eller Kanban.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Utbildning:**



* Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, elektroteknik eller motsvarande område.

### **WE OFFER**



Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden.



Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal (via Almega).





**Om Sigma Industry Development**

Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.



Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå.



**OM SIGMA GROUP**

Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development HÄR och om Sigma Group på HÄR.



Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du HÄR.


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Kristoffer Billqvist, Sektionschef Mekatronik  

+46 708102082  

Kristoffer.Billqvist@sigma.se

title: Mechanical Engineer - OHB Sweden
description:
OHB Sweden is a leading Swedish supplier of space systems. We develop, build, test and commission satellites and subsystems for space missions in, for example, communication, earth observation and space research for institutional and commercial customers within and outside Europe.
  
Building a satellite requires a broad range of expertise, involving the analysis, design, manufacturing, and testing of both hardware and software. At OHB Sweden, we offer engineers an exceptional opportunity to expand their technical skills across all domains.
  
We are seeking a skilled Mechanical Engineer with experience in the complete chain from CAD mechanical design, FEM analysis, and generation of production drawings to follow-on testing of the manufactured product.
  
Collaborating with external partners (customers, payload suppliers, etc.) to define and implement mechanical interfaces will be an integral part of your daily responsibilities.
  
Why Join Us?
  
**Dynamic Work Environment:** Engage in a vibrant, international setting with numerous collaboration partners, primarily in Europe.
  
**Comprehensive Skill Development:** Enhance your expertise in various technical domains, from Mechanical design to System engineering.
  
**Team Collaboration:** Work closely with system, electrical, thermal, and AIT engineers in the development of cutting-edge satellites.
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

A structured, motivated, and quick-learning team player.
  
Ability to work independently while meeting agreed delivery schedules.
  
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with diverse teams.
  
  

If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of space technology and eager to contribute to innovative satellite projects, we would love to hear from you!
  
If you wish to participate to the development of future space systems, feel confident that your experience and qualifications match the above requirements and want to find yourself in a dynamic and inspiring work environment, then we very much look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

**Task Description:**  

Design mechanical, structural, and dynamic components using CAD and FEM, focusing on stress, shock, and random vibration analyses.
  
Generate manufacturing drawings from CAD models.
  
Supervise off-site manufacturing of parts and inspect delivered items.
  
Support on-site assembly of end products, such as spacecraft structures.
  
Define and design test specifications, procedures, and setups for subsystem qualification (structures, mechanisms, units, components, actuators).
  
Correlate FE models (e.g., fundamental frequencies, damping coefficients) with actual test results.
  
Assist in planning and budgeting for future programs and projects.
  
Design, assemble, and test mechanical ground support equipment (MGSE) for integration and test activities.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related disciplines.
  
Minimum of 2 years of experience in design and testing/production environments
  
Relevant experience in design and testing environments related to CAD, mechanical FEM analysis, and construction (experience in aerospace or automotive industries is a plus).
  
Proficiency in FEM analysis, particularly in random vibration response, shock, and loads analysis.
  
Ability to generate, read, and understand mechanical design/analysis reports and Interface Control Documents (ICDs).
  
Clear and coherent reporting and presentation skills in English.
  
Experience in design-to-manufacture processes.
  
Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
  
Located in or willing to relocate to Stockholm, Sweden.
  
  

**Added Advantageous Qualifications:**  

Experience in writing test procedures for vibration and shock.
  
Experience in requirements management and verification.
  
Proficiency with NASTRAN.
  
Experience with CREO and/or NX (CAD) and Windchill PLM.
  
Experience working closely with production/MAIT.
  
Experience in GPS (Geometric Product Specifications) drawing production.
  
Knowledge of the European Cooperation for Space Standardization (ECSS) and experience in the space industry.
  
  

We looking forward to your application!
